sn46.48:4.1: “Mendicants, the dawn is the forerunner and precursor of the sunrise.
sn46.48:4.3: In the same way, for a mendicant good friendship is the forerunner and precursor of the arising of the seven awakening factors.
sn46.48:4.5: A mendicant with good friends can expect to
sn46.48:4.6: develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors.
sn46.48:4.7: And how does a mendicant with good friends develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors?
sn46.48:4.8: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening-factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, samādhi, and
sn46.48:4.9: equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn46.48:4.10: That’s how a mendicant with good friends develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors.”
